content: x 72 row in mosaic pattern is 4x4 inches 10x10 cm measured over the finished sock laying flat not stretched make sure you have correct gauge stitches more important than row or be prepared to add the socks to the gift basket as the size of the sock depends on it mosaic knitting will look large until you have worked a couple of inches so don t despair that the cast on looks huge needles 2 25 mm us 1 or size to get gauge use 2 circulars for the cast on easiest if you do not own two of the same size a smaller size will work for the cast on too it is also possible to use a scrap yarn provisional cast on but you will need to transfer the stitches back onto the needle before bind off yarn arwetta classic 210 m/50 g main colour mc dark grey 70 g contrast colour cc lime green 50 g for a size m pair of socks other tools needed stitch markers crochet hook for bind off one size smaller than your knitting needle darning needle the bobble can be worked using knitting needles too if you find that easier walking in circles by anne-lise maigaard littlegreendragon © 2021 april page 1 read this page all the way through before you begin how to read the foot and leg chart mosaic knitting in garter stitch mosaic patterns are slip_stitch patterns you will be working with only one colour yarn at a time first two row in one colour then two row in the other colour each charted row is worked twice - first from right to left and and then from left to right the second time working the row you can simply work as the stitches show you without looking at the chart mosaic charts show colours only there are no symbols in the chart when working garter stitch stitches in the colour of the row are knit on both right side rs and wrong side ws stitches in the other colour are slipped purlwise with yarn on ws of work that is with yarn in back on rs row and with yarn in front on ws row the first stitch in the charted row show you which colour to use if you should be in doubt change colour at the beginning of every rs row at the top of the leg don t twist the yarns when changing keep the yarn snug but not tight when changing for this particular pattern all cc row are short row as the toe is worked in mc only cc row end at the end of the foot and leg chart when turning for short row use wrap & turn wrap & turn having worked the last cc stitch of the chart slide next stitch to right needle with yarn in back bring yarn to front and slide the stitch back to left needle turn tighten yarn to reduce slack keep very
